title: Sub Question 1
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

· Possible answers: it was their custom/customary practice

· NOT acceptable: untrustworthy (syn)/lest he might escape/because he was a traitor/because he had caused deaths

title: Sub Question 4
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Translations (1 point):

· lest/in order that he not/may not/might not/would not/should not plead/say/make his case/cause

· to not plead/say/make; in order not to plead/say/make his case/cause

· clause must express purpose (cannot be past tense)
Identification (1 point):

purpose or negative purpose

title: Sub Question 5
stimulusHtml:
2 points maximum

Suspected (1 point):

Possible answers: committed suicide/killed himself/took his own life/offed himself

Latin to support answer (1 point):

quote must include sibi mortem consciverit - quin and ipse are optional
NOT acceptable: the entire quote as in the prompt or the entire quote written out word for word.

title: Sub Question 6
stimulusHtml:
1 point maximum

Possible answers include:

· built a wall/made a blockade

· manned the wall

· set up/positioned guards/soldiers

· gathered up/conscripted/drafted/additional/new legions

· told them no/told them they could not go through the province/told them that they did not have his permission to go through the province.

· stalled them by postponing or pretending to postpone his decision

· broke/took down/destroyed/burned/cut off the bridge (student need no specify at Geneva or over the Rhone)

· he controls the surrounding areas
